condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.4.2 Support roll out of School Improvement, Monitoring and Planning initiative through community and child/adolescent participation in 10 (5 in 2015; 5 in 2016) for gradual transformation to Child Friendly School environments.

description.narrative: 17,931 PTA members have been trained with UNICEF support during 2014-2017 to enhance their capacity for development, implementation, financing, and monitoring of school improvement plans to enhance quality and inclusive education using child friendly schools principles. In 2017 1,760 PTA and SIP committee members in 636 schools were trained | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018

title.narrative: Schools with school development plans that explicitly address equity issues and that were developed thanks to UNICEF support
a3. School management committees (or parent teacher association or school communities or similar structure) trained with UNICEF funding - see guidance
Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
Number of adolescents girls and boys in formal and non-formal education participating in skills-based extra curricula activities
